$interpreted: Devious: Come on, everybody gets one storybook.
Devious: Hehe, after you're finished, don't forget to lend it to someone else.
Grumbling Orphan: Thank you, High Priest...
Grumbling Orphan: Tsk...another book about the Snake God~
Fed Up Orhapn: This sucks. I'm sick of this crap. So boring! I'd rather have some nice clothes and a doll~
Grumbling Orphan: Devious is going to tell us the same old story again. We'd better go play somewhere else!
Joshua: ......
Headmaster: Thank you, High Priest, for giving the children so many books.
Devious: ... *sigh*... I wanted to bring some clothes and toys for the children,  but the donations to the Shrine are not what they used to be...
Headmaster: Indeed...to be honest, these past few years the nobles have rarely offered subsidies to the orphanage.
Headmaster: The orphanage on the east side may even have to close its doors...

Devious: ... *sigh*... The aristocrats, it doesn't matter who dies, all they care about is the struggle for the throne. 
It's no surprise they don't attend to other matters.
Headmaster: I hope these conflicts come to an end soon...
Young Cleric: High Priest, it is almost time to hold the evening prayer. We ought to be getting back to the Shrine.
Devious: When I am free I will bring some things back with me. Please, take care of the children.
Young Cleric: If the High Priest really wants to help the orphans, there must be an easier way...
Devious: You...what do you mean?
Young Cleric: High Priest, you know as well as I do that many of the nobles would love the support of the Shrine...

Devious: Enough! The struggle for the throne is a display of God's will, an expression of the natural order! 

If we interfere for our own benefit, the Snake God will never forgive us!
Young Cleric: Who is more knowledgable about the will of the Snake God and Goddess than you──
Devious: Enough! Let's go!
Devious: You...!
Andrew: Andrew Giuliano Gomez, of the royal family. We've met before, High Priest.
Devious: You! It was you──
Andrew: Please, High Priest, don't misunderstand me. I have been trying to meet with you for some time now.
Andrew: I just want to sit down and talk with you...
Devious: So you've been getting close with and using my clerics!
Young Cleric: High Priest, please hear Mr. Gomez out!
Joshua: Help!!!
Andrew: It's a child!
Devious: Joshua!
Devious: Joshua, why are you trying to sneak into the Shrine again?
Joshua: Because, I-I...
Joshua: I don't want to stay in the orphanage any longer! I'm not an orphan!
Andrew: High Priest, this is...
Devious: Six months ago, this child was abandoned in the Shrine by his parents...
Joshua: I was not abandoned! I j-j-just got lost!
Joshua: Maybe my mom is still in the Shrine waiting for me...
Devious: Joshua, I understand how you feel...but if you keep running away without telling anyone, we'll all be worried about you.
Joshua: I...but I...
Devious: Okay, why don't you come back to the Shrine with me tonight? I'll take you back tomorrow.
Andrew: Let me take you and the child back. I wouldn't want you to run into more monsters.
Devious: ...Fine. Thank you for your kindness.
Young Cleric: High Priest, it's an infant. She's a snake demihuman...inside there's a note that says the family is unable to raise the child.
Young Cleric: They hope the Snake God will care for her...
Devious: ...*sigh*...poor child. This is already the third this month...
Joshua: Do her father and mother not want her...?
Andrew: Does this happen often?
Andrew: I mean...children being abandoned at the entrance of the Shrine...?
Devious: Sir, it's certainly more than you can even imagine.
Devious: Tomorrow I will do as I always do and send this child to the orphanage.
Devious: Thank you for seeing us home.
Andrew: ......

Model.Text: Come on, everybody gets one storybook.
Hehe, after you're finished, don't forget to lend it to someone else.
Thank you, High Priest...
Tsk...another book about the Snake God~
This sucks. I'm sick of this crap. So boring! I'd rather have some nice clothes and a doll~
Devious is going to tell us the same old story again. We'd better go play somewhere else!
Thank you, High Priest, for giving the children so many books.
... *sigh*... I wanted to bring some clothes and toys for the children,  but the donations to the Shrine are not what they used to be...
Indeed...to be honest, these past few years the nobles have rarely offered subsidies to the orphanage.
The orphanage on the east side may even have to close its doors...

... *sigh*... The aristocrats, it doesn't matter who dies, all they care about is the struggle for the throne. 
It's no surprise they don't attend to other matters.
I hope these conflicts come to an end soon...
High Priest, it is almost time to hold the evening prayer. We ought to be getting back to the Shrine.
When I am free I will bring some things back with me. Please, take care of the children.
If the High Priest really wants to help the orphans, there must be an easier way...
You...what do you mean?
High Priest, you know as well as I do that many of the nobles would love the support of the Shrine...

Enough! The struggle for the throne is a display of God's will, an expression of the natural order! 

If we interfere for our own benefit, the Snake God will never forgive us!
Who is more knowledgable about the will of the Snake God and Goddess than you──
Enough! Let's go!
You...!
Andrew Giuliano Gomez, of the royal family. We've met before, High Priest.
You! It was you──
Please, High Priest, don't misunderstand me. I have been trying to meet with you for some time now.
I just want to sit down and talk with you...

Joshua!

I don't want to stay in the orphanage any longer! I'm not an orphan!

I...but I...
Okay, why don't you come back to the Shrine with me tonight? I'll take you back tomorrow.
Let me take you and the child back. I wouldn't want you to run into more monsters.
...Fine. Thank you for your kindness.
High Priest, it's an infant. She's a snake demihuman...inside there's a note that says the family is unable to raise the child.
They hope the Snake God will care for her...
...*sigh*...poor child. This is already the third this month...
Do her father and mother not want her...?
Does this happen often?
I mean...children being abandoned at the entrance of the Shrine...?
Sir, it's certainly more than you can even imagine.

Thank you for seeing us home.
